content.raw: Option 1 seems to be the better choice. Going back in time to the last user interaction is more clear than reversing the last command, and will also result in a more stable simulation experience. This is also the behavior that most people would want from undo. The flow of simulation time will be consistent with the state of simulation, and will match other features like log playback. Jumping back will also be consistent with keyframes, when that capability is added.
